messages.message:
Hello and good evening! You and I have much to talk about, and if we don't get certain things sorted out and understood between us I'm afraid that any conflict that might arise would surely sink us both.

First thing's first, I would greatly prefer if we could keep  Silesia and Prussia demilitarized, as well as Bohemia should such a situation arise.
messages.input:
My response to RUSSIA:'Hello and good evening! You and I have much to talk about, and if we don't get certain things sorted out and understood between us I'm afraid that any conflict that might arise would surely sink us both.

First thing's first, I would greatly prefer if we could keep  Silesia and Prussia demilitarized, as well as Bohemia should such a situation arise.'.

messages.message: Hi hello, I agree there's no need to start a ruckus on the eastern front. Truce on those three for now. Where are you looking to head first?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Hi hello, I agree there's no need to start a ruckus on the eastern front. Truce on those three for now. Where are you looking to head first?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's agreement to demilitarize Silesia, Prussia, and potentially Bohemia aligns with your initial proposal and indicators a willingness to maintain peace in the mentioned territories .

messages.message: The British are an existential threat to anyone with a border on the Atlantic, I'd prefer to dispatch them first and foremost.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'The British are an existential threat to anyone with a border on the Atlantic, I'd prefer to dispatch them first and foremost.'.

messages.message: Agreed - I'll be in swe, you take den for now?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Agreed - I'll be in swe, you take den for now?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's swift agreement to your proposal without any negotiation or discussion raises suspicions about their true intentions. This sudden compliance may indicate a lack of sincerity or potential deceit.

messages.message: That's the plan, though in the future, after the British are gone, I'd very much like to make Sweden and Denmark demilitarized as well.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'That's the plan, though in the future, after the British are gone, I'd very much like to make Sweden and Denmark demilitarized as well.'.

messages.message: It's obviously too dangerous for the time being
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'It's obviously too dangerous for the time being'.

messages.message: Ain't no England ever send both fleets East that wasn't aiming to take on the Russians, in my experience.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Ain't no England ever send both fleets East that wasn't aiming to take on the Russians, in my experience.'.

messages.message: Also, you working with the Turks? I can help hasten Austria's demise if you are.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Also, you working with the Turks? I can help hasten Austria's demise if you are.'.

messages.message: thanks, appreciate it! Can you let me scooch into Swe?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'thanks, appreciate it! Can you let me scooch into Swe?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's simple and direct request to move into Sweden is in line with your previous interactions and can be seen as a transparent move aligning with your shared goals.

messages.message: Of course, can I get Vienna?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Of course, can I get Vienna?'.

messages.message: danke and sure thing!
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'danke and sure thing!'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's prompt agreement to your request for Vienna indicates a willingness to cooperate and suggests a level of trustworthiness in their communication.

messages.message: is sweden a lost cause for me?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'is sweden a lost cause for me?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's inquiry about the status of Sweden implies a sense of cooperation and a desire to understand the current situation, indicating a genuine interest in strategizing together.

messages.message: alliance with england is a lose for you in the long run
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'alliance with england is a lose for you in the long run'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's statement attempting to dissuade you from an alliance with England may indicate a self-serving agenda that could potentially lead to discord between you and England, benefiting Russia in the long run.

messages.message: I am so friggin' sorry, I was toying around with my orders for a while the other day before the turn in and apparently never clicked "update" on the finalized version x.x I'm a complete mess this game, you can just ask France
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'I am so friggin' sorry, I was toying around with my orders for a while the other day before the turn in and apparently never clicked "update" on the finalized version x.x I'm a complete mess this game, you can just ask France'.

messages.message: never trust the germans, they told me!
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'never trust the germans, they told me!'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's statement about not trusting Germans based on information they received does not provide any specific details or context, making it a vague and potentially manipulative comment to sow distrust between you and Russia.

messages.message: Well that's France, of course they would tell you that! :p But seriously, it was just me being a goofy lil' bitch and not hitting the buttons correctly when I needed to.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Well that's France, of course they would tell you that! :p But seriously, it was just me being a goofy lil' bitch and not hitting the buttons correctly when I needed to.'.

messages.message: so much for DMZ...
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'so much for DMZ...'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's comment about the demilitarized zone (DMZ) being violated could be a tactic to heighten tensions or manipulate the situation, especially if there was no established agreement on specific demilitarized zones previously.

messages.message: Really looked like y'all were going for a juggernaut, there's certain circumstances that necessitate the breaking of even the most earnest promise.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Really looked like y'all were going for a juggernaut, there's certain circumstances that necessitate the breaking of even the most earnest promise.'.

messages.message: you've done me dirty on literally every single turn!
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'you've done me dirty on literally every single turn!'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Russia's accusation of being treated unfairly on every turn may be an exaggeration or a tactic to sow discord and manipulate you. It is important to critically assess the specific actions and agreements made in previous turns to determine the validity of such a claim.

messages.message: Only 2/3 of them!
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Only 2/3 of them!'.

messages.message: According to Meatloaf that's not bad!
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'According to Meatloaf that's not bad!'.

messages.message: genuinely curious why you're not moving south though
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'genuinely curious why you're not moving south though'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Russia's inquiry about your lack of southern movements demonstrates a genuine interest in understanding your strategy and motives, indicating a potential willingness to cooperate or negotiate based on your response.

messages.message: Because Austria's no threat to me.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Because Austria's no threat to me.'.
